ygData.messageBody:
X-Mailer: Microsoft Internet E-mail/MAPI - 8.0.0.4211
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

From what I understand on Specialization, it will let you cast the same
spells you have been casting with less mana and greater effects, and with
less downtime between spells.

The only hybrid spells I could see being done through research would be
teleport spells. This would be a great boon to us enchanters. If we can
look like anything and go anywhere, we'll be extremely powerful travelwise.

On Friday, May 28, 1999 10:53 AM, Robin McCaig [SMTP:twister@...]
wrote:
> From: "Robin McCaig" <twister@...>
>
> I hear that when Specialization come in that we will be able to cast the
> spell using less mana depending on what we are specializing in. That
being
> the case, If we specialize in a certain area such as conjuration, will we
> get new spells such as summon food and water, etc. If they decide to let
us
> have hybrid spells from other races, it seems to me like they should
limit
> the spells the wizard gets depending on which area of specialization he
is
> in. If I wated to get SoW for example, I would have to train in the
> specialization spell trait that is used when SoW is cast (alteration,
> divination, etc.). This would allow us to get hybrid spells without
making
> us too powerful, and allow the wizard player to be able to be a more well
> rounded profession rather than being so dependant on others to buff and
> group with. I don't know about you, but there are times when I am
playing
> and no one is online who wants to group with me. This can be frustrating
> cause we are not good at melee.
>
> Just my two cents worth.
>
>
